definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: We overthrow the old qc group, because they are out of date.
sentences.chinese: 我們推翻了老舊的品管組織，因爲他們已經過時了。

sentences.english: Looking through the atmosphere is somewhat like looking through a piece of old, stained glass.
sentences.chinese: 透過大氣層觀測有些像透過一片老舊的有色玻璃。

sentences.english: Old pitons should not be reused once they fall out.
sentences.chinese: 老舊的巖釘一旦脫出之後，就不得重新加以使用。

sentences.english: In the sunniest spot stood an old mansion surrounded by a deep moat.
sentences.chinese: 在陽光最充足的地方矗立着一棟老舊的大宅邸。

sentences.english: The old bridge threatened to colla e beneath the weight of our truck.
sentences.chinese: 這座老舊的橋樑恐怕快被我們卡車的重量給壓垮了。

sentences.english: I could imagine that my old penholder feels reproachfully towards me.
sentences.chinese: 可以想象，那根老舊的筆架肯定在責怪我。

sentences.english: He also said that Lorca old building is not easy to resist earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 他還說，洛爾卡的建築老舊，也不容易抵禦地震。

sentences.english: Should we remove or keep ancient aging buildings?
sentences.chinese: 老舊的建築究竟該拆還是留？

sentences.english: They used fluorescent lights, so they had that distinct metallic, oldish smell places that use fluorescents always have.
sentences.chinese: 使用熒光燈的地方總是充斥着老舊的氣息。

sentences.english: She lived at the old red mill on the green hill.
sentences.chinese: 她住在翠綠山丘上的老舊紅磨坊裏。

sentences.english: The city's museums are filled with mouldy old collections.
sentences.chinese: 市內博物館中塞滿老舊乏味的收藏品。

sentences.english: It is an old town with buildings that need a lot of fixing-up done to them.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個有著很多需要維修的老舊建築的老鄉鎮。

sentences.english: It seemed lost in her worn, old shopping bag.
sentences.chinese: 它在薩默斯太太那老舊的購物袋裏彷彿不見了蹤影。

sentences.english: Nung-fu needs a new blade for the old shredder.
sentences.chinese: 農夫的老舊鉸碎機需換新刀片。

sentences.english: This old and rusty rifle is a dead shot.
sentences.chinese: 正是這隻老舊的來福槍命中了那致命的一槍。

sentences.english: But the games are here and some of the older, shabby neighborhoods remain.
sentences.chinese: 奧林匹克競賽已經到來，但周邊的殘破老舊也依舊在。

definition: building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
a building used as a factory/factory (building)/CL:座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
to replace (a worn-out tire etc)/to change (one's address etc)
exterior appearance/to view sth from the outside/exterior condition
